page.title: 13Employment
page.content: Fortunately, the rate of unemployment in the area is well below the national average. The demand for labour reaches its peak during the summer tourist season, mainly from the hotel and restaurant trades, when a large number of casual workers are taken on. Some of these are school children. The opening of a new supermarket by the Preston firm of Booth's in April 1985 provided over 70 new jobs. It was built on the site of the railway station, which moved 200m. down the line, and used several of its buildings. The effect on the smaller food shops in the village has been very marked, although cushioned to some extent by the influx of summer visitors. Winter will be the telling time - perhaps one or even two of them would not be able to carry on.
